comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111112223703

Steps to reproduce:

1. Moved a lot of messages from one IMAP folder to another one.
2. Renamed the destination folder.


Actual results:

It seems that the rename command was executed while the move operation was still in progress. The result was a popup message for each mail still to be moved (paraphrased; my original message was in de-DE):

The current operation in "[Old destination folder name]" failed. The server of account "[IMAP Account]" answered: Mailbox doesn't exist: [Old destination folder name]


Expected results:

Thunderbird should have recognized that there is a running operation targeting the IMAP folder, and should have renamed it after all moves would have been done. Or, it should have renamed the folder and continued moving the mails, but to the new destination folder name.

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111112223703

Steps to reproduce:

1. Moved a lot of messages from one IMAP folder to another one.
2. Renamed the destination folder.


Actual results:

It seems that the rename command was executed while the move operation was still in progress. The result was a popup message for each mail still to be moved (paraphrased; my original message was in de-DE):

The current operation in "[Old destination folder name]" failed. The server of account "[IMAP Account]" answered: Mailbox doesn't exist: [Old destination folder name]


Expected results:

Thunderbird should have recognized that there is a running operation targeting the IMAP folder, and should have renamed it after all moves would have been done. Or, it should have renamed the folder and continued moving the mails, but to the new destination folder name.

comments.creator: vseerror@lehigh.edu
comments.text: Sounds like this would be a duplicate of our interrupted URL issue
comments.raw_text: Sounds like this would be a duplicate of our interrupted URL issue

comments.text:
Move and copies between folder within an imap server are handled internally by the server.  (I assume the reporter is moving messages in the same account.) So I might think the server would respond to rename of the destination folder with a NO response (i.e., try again later) if the user attempts a rename before the copy or move finishes. So this could be blamed on the server.

Maybe the same could be said for copy/move between different servers or accounts. The destination server is running the append imap command sent by tb. If a rename occurs before the append is complete, the server should also issue a NO response to the rename.

Of course the workaround is for the user to just wait until the copy/move finishes before doing the rename, which seems like a reasonable thing to do.
comments.raw_text:
Move and copies between folder within an imap server are handled internally by the server.  (I assume the reporter is moving messages in the same account.) So I might think the server would respond to rename of the destination folder with a NO response (i.e., try again later) if the user attempts a rename before the copy or move finishes. So this could be blamed on the server.

Maybe the same could be said for copy/move between different servers or accounts. The destination server is running the append imap command sent by tb. If a rename occurs before the append is complete, the server should also issue a NO response to the rename.

Of course the workaround is for the user to just wait until the copy/move finishes before doing the rename, which seems like a reasonable thing to do.
